para.sentence: For any complex symmetric matrix \mathbf{Z} , g(\mathbf{Z})=\int_{\boldsymbol{\Omega}}\mathrm{etr}\left(-\mathbf{Z}\mathbf{X }\right)f(\mathbf{X})\mathrm{d}\mathbf{X}, where the integration variable \mathbf{X} ranges over the space {\boldsymbol{\Omega}}.
Suppose there exists a constant \mathbf{X}_{0}\in{\boldsymbol{\Omega}} such that |f(\mathbf{X})|<\mathrm{etr}\left(-\mathbf{X}_{0}\mathbf{X}\right) for all \mathbf{X}\in{\boldsymbol{\Omega}}.
Then (35.2.1) converges absolutely on the region \Re(\mathbf{Z})>\mathbf{X}_{0} , and g(\mathbf{Z}) is a complex analytic function of all elements z_{j,k} of \mathbf{Z}.

Assume that \int_{\boldsymbol{\mathcal{S}}}\left|g(\mathbf{Z})\right|\mathrm{d}\mathbf{V} converges, and also that \lim_{\mathbf{U}\to\infty}\int_{\boldsymbol{\mathcal{S}}}\left|g(\mathbf{Z}) \right|\mathrm{d}\mathbf{V}=0.

Then f(\mathbf{X})=\dfrac{1}{(2\pi\mathrm{i})^{m(m+1)/2}}\int\mathrm{etr}\left( \mathbf{Z}\mathbf{X}\right)g(\mathbf{Z})\mathrm{d}\mathbf{Z}, where the integral is taken over all \mathbf{Z}=\mathbf{U}+\mathrm{i}\mathbf{V} such that \mathbf{U}>\mathbf{X}_{0} and \mathbf{V} ranges over \boldsymbol{\mathcal{S}}.

If g_{j} is the Laplace transform of f_{j} , j=1,2 , then g_{1}g_{2} is the Laplace transform of the convolution f_{1}*f_{2} , where f_{1}*f_{2}(\mathbf{T})=\int\limits_{\boldsymbol{{0}}<\mathbf{X}<\mathbf{T}}f_ {1}(\mathbf{T}-\mathbf{X})f_{2}(\mathbf{X})\mathrm{d}\mathbf{X}.
